channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kim Kardashian’s Skims is now worth $5 billion after a massive $225 million funding round led by Goldman Sachs
item.description: Young people are obsessed with Kim K's shapewear line. Nearly 70% of Skims' customers are Gen Z or millennials.

item.title: As Gen Z question the values of higher ed, CEO at this nearly $1 billion company says it’s ‘silly’ to think one degree will be enough education for life
item.description: Udemy CEO Hugo Sarrazin says the degrees vs. skills debate should be focused on “cohabitation.”

item.title: Gen Z isn’t doom spending. Wasting money on flashy purchases is normal while you’re young and have nothing else to be admired for yet, expert says
item.description: “My aspiration for material stuff is the inverse of what else I have to offer the world,” The Psychology of Money author said.

item.title: Xpanceo, A Dubai Startup, Is Building An AI XR Contact Lens
item.description: Smart contact lens startup Xpanceo, haas raised $250 million to build atom-thin AR lenses to merge vision, biosensing, and AI, ushering in an era of h...

item.title: ‘The Super Mario Galaxy Movie’ Perfectly Casts Rosalina, Gets New Trailer, Release Date
item.description: The Super Mario Galaxy Movie has cast its all-important Rosalina, and she could not be a better pick. Watch the new trailer here.

item.title: Ford CEO Jim Farley says the secret to climbing the corporate ladder flows through this department—and Tim Cook is proof it works
item.description: The secret to CEO success isn’t knowing how to code or use AI chatbots—it’s mastering the supply chain, according to Ford’s Jim Farley.

item.title: Want Futureproof Kids In The Age Of AI? Make Things Hard For Them.
item.description: In order for their kids to thrive in the age of AI, parents need to take a step back and take their tablets away.

item.title: How Cisco is leaning on recruiting and upskilling staff in the AI era—instead of mass layoffs
item.description: As AI reshapes the workplace, Cisco is betting on its existing workforce instead of mass layoffs—arming them to code, innovate, and adapt.

item.title: Toyota Opens Its First North American Lithium Ion Battery Plant
item.description: Toyota has officially opened its first lithium ion battery plant outside of Japan in Liberty, North Carolina. The plant will have capacity of 30-GWh p...

item.title: New York and New Jersey lose hundreds of billions in resident income as Americans flee to low-tax states
item.description: New York and New Jersey lost nearly $700 billion in resident income from 2013-2022 as millions fled to low-tax states like Florida and Texas in histor...

item.title: ‘ARC Raiders’ Lowers Cosmetic Prices, Has Duo Matchmaking, Talks Raider Deck Plans
item.description: ARC Raiders is moving fast with changes to cosmetic prices, duo matchmaking and raider decks which are live now, or happening soon.

item.title: Why cutting drug prices is pushing Eli Lilly’s stock to all-time highs
What typically happens after the stock market starts November with a sputter
Economic calendar: Six Fed speeches on the day’s docket
What’s the right time of year to take my RMD?
IBM announces a microchip to help develop quantum computer
How one company is transforming rural communities with tech careers
item.description: IT services company Provalus is revitalizing rural communities by bringing hundreds of technology jobs and spurring local business development.

item.title: Mission after the uniform: New effort helps veterans win the job battle at home
item.description: Veteran job applicants are getting a "second chance" to match their grit and expertise to civilian careers, offering them the ability to connect to em...

item.title: Activist investor pushes Cracker Barrel shareholders to oust DEI specialist
item.description: Cracker Barrel faces proxy fight as activist investor claims company's rebranding "fiasco" destroyed $1.2 billion in shareholder value amid leadership...

item.title: How VA loans help veterans achieve the American dream
item.description: VA home loans provide veterans lifetime benefits, including no-down-payment requirements, competitive rates, and reusable guarantees for purchases and...

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
